metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7843 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The __clear_user function in arch/arm64/lib/clear_user.S in the Linux kernel before 3.17.4 on the ARM64 platform allows local users to cause a denial of service (system crash) by reading one byte beyond a /dev/zero page boundary. Miloš Prchlík reported a flaw in how the ARM64 platform handles a single byte overflow in __clear_user. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) by reading one byte beyond a /dev/zero page boundary.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7843` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-44-generic - 3.13.0-44.73
linux-image-3.13.0-44-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-44.73
linux-image-3.13.0-44-lowlatency - 3.13.0-44.73
linux-image-3.13.0-44-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-44.73
linux-image-3.13.0-44-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-44.73
linux-image-3.13.0-44-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-44.73
linux-image-3.13.0-44-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-44.73
linux-image-3.13.0-44-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-44.73
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-44-generic - 3.13.0-44.73
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-29-generic - 3.16.0-29.39~14.04.1

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.04 preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-44.73').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.16.0-29.39~14.04.1').
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-44.73').
